This Jobot Job is hosted by Jose Moran

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.

Salary $50,000 - $60,000 per year

A Bit About Us

Based in DuPage County, IL, we are a national leader in the houseware industry. Our core values are centered around our people and our clients. We believe that putting your employees first is not only the right thing to do, but it also gives us the competitive edge to ensure our clients have an excellent experience! Over the years our reputation for providing our people with the very best has caught the eye of some reputable clients who have chosen to use us as primary partners.

If you are an Accountant with 1-2 years of experience, then please apply!



Why join us?


Do you want to work with some of the nationâ€™s best Clients AND enjoy time at home w/ family? We do too!

 Direct Hire Opportunity! Meaningful Work! Best in Class Company! Competitive Compensation Package! Complete Benefits Package! Accelerated Career Growth! Fun Company Activities! Many More!

Job Details

Job Details

We are seeking a dynamic Entry Level Accountant Associate to join our fast-paced team. This is a fantastic opportunity for a detail-oriented, self-motivated individual with a solid understanding of accounting principles and excellent communication skills. The successful candidate will possess a strong work ethic, a commitment to excellence, and the ability to seamlessly integrate into a team environment. The role will entail a variety of responsibilities, from managing accounts payable and receivable to conducting profit and loss analysis. This position is perfect for someone who is fluent in both English and Korean, and is eager to apply their financial acumen in a dynamic, fast-paced industry.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate for the Permanent Accountant Associate position will have the following qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. 1-2 years of experience in an accounting role. Proficiency in accounts payable, accounts receivable, and inventory management. Excellent skills in Excel, Word, and Outlook. Strong understanding of cash flow management and profit and loss analysis. Bilingual in English and Korean. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work well in a team environment and to meet deadlines. Familiarity with accounting software and systems.
